questions.text: Which of the following is true about exotoxins?

options.label: A
options.text: They are less potent than endotoxin

options.label: B
options.text: All exotoxins have same mechanism of action

options.label: D

A specimen of thick, bloody sputum from a hospitalized 80-year-old patient with diabetes mellitus and difficulty in breathing is sent for laboratory analyses. The tests yield heavy growth of a lactose-positive, nonmotile, gram-negative rod with a large capsule. Which of the following bacteria is most likely to be the cause of the pulmonary problems?

Rajesh, a 23-year-old male was admitted 5 days after a crush injury to his right leg following a road traffic accident. He had been treated by a local village quack. On examination, the wound which was bandaged with a soiled gauze, appeared to be heavily contaminated with soil, the local muscles appeared to have been crushed, there was oedema and pain at the site and crepitus was felt on palpation. Which of the following is false about the suspected causative agent?
Adsorbed toxoid vaccine of anthrax contains
A 4-year-old has fever and diarrhoea. Blood culture grows a gram-negative rod. This is most likely to be which of the following?
Bejel is caused by

A 20-year-old college student develops diarrhoea that lasts for approximately 1 week. Stool cultures reveal a motile, microaerophilic gram-negative rod that is isolated by incubation at 41°C (105.8°F) on medium containing antibiotics. This organism is most likely to be which of the following?
Rat bite fever is caused by
The following drugs are indicated in brucellosis, except
Survival of M. tuberculosis inside the macrophages is due to

options.label: A
options.text: Inhibition of entry into the host cell

options.label: B
options.text: Inhibition of entry into the phagosome

questions.text: Site of action of tetanus toxin
questions.correct_answer: A. Presynaptic terminal of spinal cord

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true of cholera enterotoxin?

options.label: A
options.text: Appears to produce its effect by stimulating adenyl-cyclase activity in mucosal cells

options.label: B
options.text: Causes destruction of the intestinal mucosa allowing for invasive infection

options.label: C
options.text: Causes a net efflux of ions and water from tissue into the lumen of the large intestine

options.label: D
options.text: Is a protein with a molecular weight of approximately 284,000 daltons

questions.correct_answer: A. Appears to produce its effect by stimulating adenyl-cyclase activity in mucosal cells

questions.text: A 2-year-old child attending day care develops diarrhoea and gastroenteritis as a result of an adenoviral infection. Which of the following adenoviral serotypes would most likely be responsible for this girl’s illness?
Fever, leukopenia, disseminated intravascular coagulation, and hypotension caused by members of the Enterobacteriaceae family are most strongly associated with which of the following structures?

A 32-year-old HIV infected male is noted to have acute CMV infection causing acute gastrointestinal symptoms. The treating physician has ordered that antiviral therapy be administered. Which of the following is most likely to be targeted by the antiviral agent?
Post-streptococcal glomerulonephritis: which antibody level is raised?

A 35-year-old man with AIDS presents to the local clinic with complaints of nausea, vomiting, confusion, fever and staggering gait. A lumbar puncture is performed, and an organism with a halo is noted with India ink preparation. What drug would be most beneficial?
Which is the highly infective stage in whooping cough?
Cause of melioidosis is

During an emergency surgery, a 60-year-old male is found to have severe peritonitis and a perforated colon. Foul-smelling cloudy peritoneal fluid is collected. Subsequent analysis reveals the growth of black pigmented colonies on Bacteroides bile esculin agar. No growth is detected in the presence of kanamycin, colistin, or vancomycin. Which of the following microorganisms is most likely involved in this case?

Your patient is a 2-week-old infant who was well until 2 days ago, when she stopped feeding and became irritable. She now has a fever to 38 degree Celsius, developed a petechial rash all over her body, and is very difficult to arouse. In the emergency room, a blood culture and a spinal tap were done. Gram stain of the spinal fluid showed gram-positive cocci in chains. Culture of the spinal fluid on blood agar revealed ?-hemolytic colonies that grew in the presence of bacitracin and hydrolyzed hippurate. Which one of the following is the most likely causative organism?
Which specimen should never be refrigerated?
Regarding immunologic tolerance, which one of the following is the most accurate?

options.label: A
options.text: Clonal deletion occurs with T cells but not with B cells.

options.label: B
options.text: Tolerance to certain self antigens occurs by negative selection of immature T cells in the thymus

options.label: C
options.text: The presence of B7 on the surface of the antigen-presenting cell is one of the essential steps required to establish tolerance

options.label: D
options.text: Tolerance is easier to establish in adults than in newborns because more self-reactive T cells have undergone apoptosis in adults than in newborns

questions.correct_answer: B. Tolerance to certain self antigens occurs by negative selection of immature T cells in the thymus

questions.text: Food poisoning within 4- 6 hours of intake of food indicates presence of toxin of

A hospitalized patient developed severe diarrhoea and pseudomembranous colitis within 5 days after antibiotic therapy was initiated. The severe diarrhoea and pseudomembranous colitis occurred as a result of which of the following?
The mechanism of action of the exotoxin produced by C. diphtheriae can be characterized by which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Acting as a superantigen that binds to MHC class II protein and the T-cell receptor

options.label: B
options.text: Blocking the release of acetylcholine causing anticholinergic symptoms.

options.label: C
options.text: Blocking the release of glycine (inhibitory neurotransmitter).

options.label: D
options.text: Inhibits protein synthesis via EF-2 adenosine diphosphate (ADP) ribosylation.

questions.correct_answer: D. Inhibits protein synthesis via EF-2 adenosine diphosphate (ADP) ribosylation.

questions.text: Several children are hospitalized with bloody diarrhoea and severe haematological abnormalities. A 4-year-old girl dies of kidney failure shortly after admittance. An epidemiological investigation establishes that all of the patients developed symptoms following consumption of hamburgers from the same fast-food restaurant chain. Which of the following organisms is most likely to be responsible for the outbreak?
questions.correct_answer: C. O157:H7 serotype of Escherichia coli

questions.text: Several days after an appendectomy a patient develops a high fever, dangerously low blood pressure, and disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC). Based on these and other findings, a diagnosis of septicaemia as a result of an enteric gram-negative rod is made. Which of the following cytokines is most likely to be responsible for the fever, low blood pressure, and DIC?
Human fibroblast cell line is used for cultivation of
A 25-year-old female has developed fever, sore throat, and lymphadenopathy accompanied with atypical lymphocytosis and an increase in sheep cell agglutinins. The diagnosis is most likely:
HSV-1 differs from HSV-2 by all except

options.label: A
options.text: Most common site of latency-trigeminal neuron

options.label: B
options.text: Most common site of lesion- around mouth

questions.text: Congenital toxoplasmosis is more severe in which trimester of pregnancy?
For infection of mosquito, the blood of human carrier must contain at least

A 33-year-old woman has chronic diarrhoea. A fecal sample is obtained. Microscopic identification of which of the following stages of the organism would provide the strongest evidence for cryptosporidiosis?

An unimmunized, 2-year-old boy presents with drooling from the mouth, elevated temperature, and enlarged tonsils . During attempts at intubation, no grey-white membrane is observed but the epiglottis appears “beefy” red and oedematous . Which of the following is the most likely organism?
Which of the following infection is eradicated from India?
Sputum specimen sent for culture is considered good quality if it contains

options.label: A
options.text: Pus cells <5/low power field and epithelial cells >25/low power field

options.label: B
options.text: Pus cells >25/low power field and epithelial cells <5/ low power field

options.label: C
options.text: Pus cells >25/low power field and epithelial cells > 25/low power field

questions.correct_answer: B. Pus cells >25/low power field and epithelial cells <5/ low power field

questions.text: Which is not an ESKAPE pathogen?

A patient coming from Himachal Pradesh, presents with multiple skin lesions. Microscopy reveals cigar-shaped yeast cells and asteroid bodies. Microscopy of culture shows 'flower like’ pattern. Identify the agent?
Azole active against mucormycosis is
Interferon gamma release assay (IGRA) has the advantage over tuberculin test

options.label: D
options.text: Can be used as marker of prevalence

questions.correct_answer: C. Has no false positive result

questions.text: Regarding Sin Nombre virus (a hantavirus), which one of the following is most accurate?

options.label: A
options.text: Its main clinical manifestation is encephalitis.

options.label: B
options.text: The main reservoir is domestic animals such as pigs.

options.label: C
options.text: Infection is acquired by inhalation of dried mouse faeces and urine.

options.label: D
options.text: Oseltamivir is an effective prophylactic drug if given within 48 hours of exposure.

questions.correct_answer: C. Infection is acquired by inhalation of dried mouse faeces and urine.

questions.text: Regarding Ebola virus, which one of the following is most accurate?

options.label: A
options.text: Skunks and raccoons are the main natural reservoirs for Ebola virus.

options.label: B
options.text: In endemic areas, most people are latently infected with Ebola virus.

options.label: C
options.text: People known to be exposed to Ebola virus should be given ganciclovir to prevent disease

options.label: D
options.text: The appearance of Ebola virus in the electron microscope is that of a long thread, which often has a curved end.

questions.correct_answer: D. The appearance of Ebola virus in the electron microscope is that of a long thread, which often has a curved end.

questions.text: Regarding Japanese encephalitis virus (JEV), which one of the following is most accurate?

options.label: A
options.text: The principal reservoir of JEV is bats.

options.label: B
options.text: It is transmitted by the bite of the dog tick, Dermacentor.

options.label: C
options.text: Acyclovir is the drug of choice for encephalitis caused by JEV.

options.label: D
options.text: The killed vaccine should be given to those living in an endemic area.

questions.correct_answer: D. The killed vaccine should be given to those living in an endemic area.

questions.text: Your patient is a 40-year-old man with occasional mild right upper abdominal discomfort but is otherwise well. On examination, his liver is enlarged. An MRI reveals a cystic mass in the liver. On questioning, he says that he was born and raised in a village on a sheep ranch. Of the following, which one is the most likely cause?

A 45-year-old sailor presents to your office with penile lesions. He says that he first noticed a papule on his penis. Soon thereafter, several draining ulcers formed and his inguinal region began to hurt. He also complains of mild fever and red eyes. Cell scrapings from the genital lesions show inclusion bodies. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient’s condition?

A 12-year-old male is treated with nafcillin for a skin infection and shows little response after two days of therapy. Pus microscopy shows Gram-positive cocci in clusters, and sensitivity testing demonstrates little response to nafcillin but good response to vancomycin. Which of the following would most likely explain treatment failure in this patient?

options.label: D
options.text: Active drug transport out of the cell

questions.correct_answer: B. Poor interaction with binding proteins

questions.text: An 8-year-old Middle Eastern immigrant is brought to clinic with low-grade fever and a skin rash that started on his face and spread down his body. Physical examination reveals postauricular tenderness. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient’s disease?

A 46-year-old female presents to the emergency room with fever, chest pain and haemoptysis. She works in a goat wool processing centre. Chest x-ray shows widened mediastinum. Sputum and blood cultures reveal large gram-positive rods that form ‘medusa head colonies on standard media. The bacteria isolated from this patient most likely produce

A 38-year-old female who works as a nurse at a large community hospital has the following readings of serologic markers for viral hepatitis: AntiHAV IgM Negative Anti-HAV lgG Positive HBsAg Negative HBeAg Negative Anti-HBsAg Positive Anti-HBcAg IgM Negative Anti-HBcAg lgG Negative Anti-HBeAg Negative Anti-HCV Negative This patient most likely

options.label: C
options.text: Is an asymptomatic carrier of HBV

questions.correct_answer: D. Has been vaccinated against HBV

questions.text: A sample of contaminated moist soil is heated to 100°C for 15 minutes. Which of the following bacteria is most likely to be recovered from the soil sample following heat exposure?

An 18-year-old college freshman is brought to the emergency room with a high fever, confusion and headaches. Physical examination reveals nuchal rigidity and a purpuric rash on his lower extremities. This infection could have been prevented by a vaccine containing

A 32-year-old Caucasian male develops profuse watery diarrhoea with abdominal cramps, nausea and vomiting during a trip to Mexico. The diarrhoea resolved in a couple of days without antibiotic treatment. This patient’s symptoms are most likely related to

A group of military recruits develops a disease characterized by high fever, headache, nausea and haemorrhagic skin rash. Gram-negative cocci are isolated from the blood of one of the recruits. The blood concentration of which of the following microbial components would show the closest correlation with these patients morbidity and mortality?

A 5-year-old child is brought to the ER with fever and a new skin rash (see the pic below). One week ago, his younger sister had similar symptoms that resolved spontaneously. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis given this patient’s symptoms?

A researcher finds that Streptococcus pneumoniae injected intraperitoneally is uniformly fatal to mice. Antibodies with which of the following in vitro effects on the bacterium would prevent this outcome?

Autopsy of a 14-year-old male who died of septic shock shows extensive hyperaemia and infarcts of his internal organs. Purpuric cutaneous lesions and haemorrhagic destruction of both adrenals are also present. The organism most likely responsible for this patient’s death more commonly causes which of the following?

A 34-year-old female presents with fever, dysuria and flank pain; a urine culture grows motile Gram-negative rods in colonies that have a metallic sheen on EMB agar and demonstrate haemolysis on blood agar. Which of the following is the most important pathogenic bacterial factor responsible for this patient’s condition?
Viral particles isolated from the nasal exudate of a 10-year-old male are shown to lose their infectively once exposed to ether. It can be concluded that the viral particles are most likely:
Microscopic examination of a sputum sample from a 34-year-old male with fever and cough reveals Gram positive lancet-shaped cocci in pairs. These bacteria are likely to be
A 5-year-old boy is found to have a high serum level of antibodies against polyribitol ribose phosphate (PRP). The antibodies would most likely carry protection against

A 36-year-old immigrant from Peru presents to the physician’s office because of difficulty swallowing liquids. He says he also has difficulty belching. Physical examination is unremarkable. Barium swallow shows a dilated oesophagus, and manometry confirms absent peristalsis in the smooth muscle portion of the oesophagus. If this patient’s symptoms are caused by infection, which of the following organisms is the most likely cause?

A 17-year-old female presents to your office with dark urine and facial puffiness. She had a minor skin infection several weeks ago that resolved spontaneously. Microscopic examination of the urine sediment shows red blood cell casts. The organism responsible for this patient’s symptoms would most likely demonstrate

A 49-year-old Caucasian male with a long history of cough and weight loss is found on chest x-ray to have a pulmonary infiltrate. His medical history is otherwise unremarkable. He does not use tobacco, alcohol or drugs. Bronchoscopy with transbronchial al biopsy reveals granulomatous inflammation. Which of the following agents is most likely to cause chronic pneumonia in an immunocompetent host?

E. coli isolated from a patient with diarrhoea does not ferment sorbitol on sorbitol containing MacConkey agar and does not produce glucuronidase. The toxin produced by these bacteria would most likely
A child with a helminth parasite is found to be anaemic. Which parasitic worm is linked to microcytic anaemia in children?
A 47-year-old woman in India is becoming blind due to repeated infection with Chlamydia trachomatis. What is seen in the pus draining from her eyes and stained by immunofluorescence?
Several bacteria that form spores are important human pathogens. Which one of the following is the most accurate statement about bacterial spores?

options.label: A
options.text: They are killed by boiling for 15 minutes.

options.label: B
options.text: They are produced primarily by gram-negative cocci.

options.label: C
options.text: They are formed primarily when the bacterium is exposed to antibiotics.

options.label: D
options.text: They are metabolically inactive yet can survive for years in that inactive state.

questions.correct_answer: D. They are metabolically inactive yet can survive for years in that inactive state.

questions.text: Which statement is the most accurate regarding transposons?

options.label: A
options.text: They encode enzymes that degrade the ends of the bacterial chromosome.

options.label: B
options.text: They are short sequences of DNA that often encode enzymes that mediate antibiotic resistance

options.label: C
options.text: They are short sequences of RNA that silence specific regulatory genes.

options.label: D
options.text: They are a family of transfer RNAs that enhance mutations at “hot spots” in the bacterial genome.

questions.correct_answer: B. They are short sequences of DNA that often encode enzymes that mediate antibiotic resistance

questions.text: Bacteria that cause nosocomial (hospital-acquired) infections often produce extracellular substances that allow them to stick firmly to medical devices, such as intravenous catheters. Which one of the following is the name of this extracellular substance?
The colon is the site of the largest number of normal flora bacteria. Which one of the following bacteria is found in the greatest number in the colon?

An outbreak of postsurgical wound infections caused by S. aureus has occurred in the hospital. The infection control team was asked to determine whether the organism could be carried by one of the operating room personnel. Using your knowledge of normal flora, which one of the following body sites is the most likely location for this organism?

The cells involved with pyogenic inflammation are mainly neutrophils, whereas the cells involved with granulomatous inflammation are mainly macrophages and helper T cells. Infection by which one of the following bacteria is most likely to elicit granulomatous inflammation?
Opsonization is the process by which:

options.label: A
options.text: Bacteria are made more easily phagocytozed.

options.label: B
options.text: Chemokines attract neutrophils to the site of infection.

options.label: C
options.text: Neutrophils migrate from the blood through the endothelium to reach the site of infection.

questions.correct_answer: A. Bacteria are made more easily phagocytozed.

questions.text: The identification of Salmonella and Shigella in stool cultures using Eosin–Methylene Blue (EMB) media is dependent on which one of the following properties?

options.label: A
options.text: Salmonella and Shigella produce a blue colony in the presence of methylene blue.

options.label: B
options.text: Salmonella and Shigella produce a colourless colony because they do not ferment lactose.

options.label: C
options.text: Salmonella and Shigella produce a green colony because they utilize the bile in the media.

options.label: D
options.text: Salmonella and Shigella produce a red colony in the presence of eosin.

questions.correct_answer: B. Salmonella and Shigella produce a colourless colony because they do not ferment lactose.

questions.text: Passive immunity is used to prevent or to treat disease caused by which one of the following sets of bacteria?
questions.correct_answer: A. Clostridium tetani and Clostridium botulinum

questions.text: Which one of the following sets consists of bacteria that are both anaerobes?
questions.correct_answer: C. Clostridium perfringens and Bacteroides fragilis

questions.text: The main reason why methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) strains are resistant to methicillin and nafcillin is

options.label: A
options.text: They produce ?-lactamase that degrades the antibiotics.

options.label: B
options.text: They have altered penicillin-binding proteins that have reduced binding of the antibiotics.

options.label: C
options.text: They have mutant porin proteins that prevent the antibiotics from entering the bacteria.They have plasmid-

options.label: D
options.text: Encoded export proteins that remove the drug from the bacteria.

questions.correct_answer: B. They have altered penicillin-binding proteins that have reduced binding of the antibiotics.

questions.text: Which one of the following is a large gram-positive rod that causes necrosis of tissue by producing an exotoxin that degrades lecithin, resulting in the lysis of cell membranes?

Your patient is a 40-year-old woman with diplopia and other signs of cranial nerve weakness. History reveals she grows her own vegetables and likes to preserve them in jars that she prepares at home. She is fond of her preserved string beans, which is what she ate uncooked in a salad for dinner last night. Which one of the following is the most likely cause of this clinical picture?

Your patient is a 75-year-old man with an indwelling urinary catheter following prostatectomy for prostate cancer. He now has the sudden onset of fever to 40°C, blood pressure of 70/40, and a pulse of 140. You draw several blood cultures, and the laboratory reports that all are positive for a gram-negative rod that forms red pigmented colonies. Which one of the following bacteria is the most likely cause of this infection?

The following statements are true / false regarding GeneXpert: 1. It has the lowest turnaround time (2 hours) among all the diagnostic methods currently available for TB 2. It can not be used to diagnose extrapulmonary tuberculosis. 3. It detects Rifampicin as well as Isoniazid resistance. 4. It can further speciate MTB complex. 5. It is based on by real-time PCR technique

The following statements are true / false regarding immunoglobulin isotypes: 1. IgG is the only antibody class which can cross placenta. 2. IgD is present on B cell surface as B cell receptor. 3. IgE can fix complement. 4. IgM is the isotype of secondary immune response. 5. Secretory IgA is present along mucosal surfaces

The following statements are true / false regarding Filoviruses: 1. They cause American haemorrhagic fever. 2. They are spherical in shape. 3. Ebola virus has five subtypes. 4. The reservoir for Ebolaviruses is believed to be fruitbat. 5. Human to human transmission is seen in Ebolavirus infection

The following statements are true / false regarding Bartonella spp. 1. B. henselae causes bacillary angiomatosis in immunocompetent people. 2. B. quintana causes trench fever. 3. B. bacilliformis causes oroya fever. 4. Bartonella species are obligate intracellular. 5. Bartonella species are gram negative

The following statements are true / false regarding Bacillus anthracis: 1. It is non-capsulated. 2. It shows McFadyean’s reaction. 3. It is fastidious. 4. It does not grow at 45 degree Celcius. 5. Selective medium for it is PLET medium.

The following statements are true / false regarding dermatophytes: 1. Microsporum infects hair and nails. 2. Geophilic dermatophytes infect animals 3. Dermatophytes grow rapidly on culture media. 4. Hair perforation test is positive for T.mentagrophytes 5. Urease test is positive for T.mentagrophytes

The following statements are true / false regarding cytokines. 1. IL-1 is produced by neutrophils. 2. IL-2 is T-cell growth factor. 3. IL-5 helps in class switching to IgE. 4. IL-6 helps in the production of acute phase reactants. 5. IL-12 promotes the differentiation of Th-2 cells

The following statements are true / false regarding Picornaviruses. 1. Rhinoviruses are acid-stable. 2. Echoviruses are transmitted by respiratory route. 3. Picornaviruses have helical symmetry. 4. Coxsackie viruses are called so because they were discovered by Coxsackie. 5. Enterovirus 70 causes acute haemorrhagic conjunctivitis

The following statements are true / false regarding Endotoxin. 1. A major site of action of endotoxin is the macrophage. 2. They are protein in nature. 3. They are present in gram negative organisms. 4. They do not activate complement. 5. The somatic antigen is same in all gram negative organisms

The following statements are true / false regarding Mycoplasma. 1. M.pneumoniae causes typical lobar pneumonia. 2. They can not grow on artificial media. 3. M.pneumoniae is a strict human pathogen. 4. M.pneumoniae can cause many extra-pulmonary manifestations. 5. Serologic testing is the mainstay of diagnosis of M.pneumoniae infection
Which of the structures shown is important for evading phagocytosis and preventing desiccation?
The structure shown in the given image is present in

A 4-year-old child was taken to the hospital due to marked swelling of the throat and lymph nodes and the presence of a thick, grey membrane over the throat and tonsils. Material recovered from the throat was plated on tellurite agar, and black colonies appeared after incubation, as shown. Gram stain of the colony material resembled that shown. What is the key virulence factor produced by the bacterium?
Which of the following is false about the equipment shown in the figure?

options.label: C
options.text: Efficacy is tested using Geobacillus stearothermophilus

questions.text: Which of the following is a function of the structure shown in the figure?

options.label: B
options.text: Provision of rigidity to the cell

questions.text: Your patient is a 65-year-old man with gradually increasing confusion and unsteadiness while walking. A lumbar puncture revealed clear spinal fluid, a normal glucose, and an elevated protein. There were 96 cells/mm3, of which 86% were lymphocytes. Gram stain of the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) was negative. Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brain was normal. A sample of CSF reacted with beef heart cardiolipin at a titer of 1/1024 Regarding the causative organism of his infection, which one of the following is most accurate?

options.label: A
options.text: It is transmitted by tick bite.

options.label: B
options.text: Resistance to penicillin G is common, so ceftriaxone should be used.

options.label: C
options.text: It has never been grown on bacteriologic media in the clinical laboratory.

options.label: D
options.text: It is unlikely to be eradicated because beef cattle are a major reservoir for the organism

questions.correct_answer: C. It has never been grown on bacteriologic media in the clinical laboratory.

questions.text: Your patient is a 20-year-old man with an erythematous, macular, nonpainful rash on the right arm for the past 4 days. The rash is approximately 10 cm in diameter. He also has a fever to 100°F and a mild headache. He reports hiking on several weekends recently in New York State. You suspect the rash is erythema migrans and that he has Lyme disease. Which one of the following is the best approach to confirm your clinical diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Detect IgM antibodies in an ELISA assay

options.label: B
options.text: Determine the titer in a VDRL test

options.label: C
options.text: Gram stain and culture on blood agar incubated aerobically

options.label: D
options.text: Gram stain and culture on blood agar incubated anaerobically

questions.correct_answer: A. Detect IgM antibodies in an ELISA assay

questions.text: Benzathine penicillin G is used to treat primary and secondary syphilis rather than procaine penicillin G. Which one of the following is the best reason for this choice?

options.label: A
options.text: Patients allergic to procaine penicillin G are not allergic to benzathine penicillin G

options.label: B
options.text: Benzathine penicillin G has a higher minimal inhibitory concentration than procaine penicillin G.

options.label: C
options.text: Benzathine penicillin G penetrates the central nervous system to a greater degree than procaine penicillin G.

options.label: D
options.text: Benzathine penicillin G is a depot preparation that provides a long-lasting, high level of drug that kills the slow-growing Treponema pallidum.

questions.correct_answer: A. Patients allergic to procaine penicillin G are not allergic to benzathine penicillin G

questions.text: Epidemic relapsing fever differs from endemic relapsing fever because it has

options.label: C
options.text: It is less common than endemic relapsing fever

options.label: D
options.text: For treatment, doxycycline should be given for a week

questions.text: Which spirochaete can be seen on light microscopy?
RPR differs from VDRL because

options.label: A
options.text: It uses carbon particle coated cardiolipin antigens

options.label: C
options.text: Card rotation is done for 8 minutes

questions.text: A 30-year-old female developed vaginal candidiasis (a fungal infection) after receiving antibiotic therapy for a sinus infection . One possible explanation for the fungal infection is antibiotic-induced reduction in vaginal
A 10-year-old child develops glomerulonephritis a week after he was treated for a sore throat. The causal agent is identified by serotyping of the

A bacterial culture with a starting density of 1×1000 cells/ml is incubated in liquid nutrient broth. If the bacteria have both a lag time and a generation time of 10 minutes, what will the cell density be at 30 minutes?

An HIV-positive patient with a CD4 count of 110/?L who is not taking any medications presents to an urgent care centre with complaints of a headache for the past week. He also notes nausea and intermittently blurred vision. Examination is notable for normal vital signs without fever but mild papilledema. Head CT does not show dilated ventricles. The definitive diagnostic test for this patient is:

options.label: C
options.text: Ophthalmologic examination, including visual field testing

questions.text: An 8-year-old boy presents to the emergency department with vomiting and a severe cough in which he can’t catch his breath. His vaccination history is incomplete. Physical exam reveals fever and conjunctival injection. A nasopharyngeal aspirate grew gram-negative coccobacilli on Bordet- Gengou media. What is the mechanism of action of the toxin involved?

options.label: A
options.text: ADP ribosylation of eukaryotic elongation factor 2 (eEF-2)

questions.text: A certain population of lymphocytes inhibits activity of autoreactive lymphocytes. Such lymphocytes express both

Your patient is a 60-year-old man with abdominal pain, vomiting, and weight loss for the past 2 months. He has a history of asthma that requires 20 mg of prednisone daily to control. Abdominal exam is normal, and radiographic studies are unrevealing. His white blood cell count is 10,900 with 16% eosinophils. Examination of the stool reveals rhabditiform larvae. Of the following, which organism is the MOST likely cause?

A 26-year-old woman, 8 months pregnant, visits her obstetrician complaining of fever, myalgia and backache of recent onset. Three weeks earlier, the patient had been a weekend guest at a rural farmhouse, where all the food was reported to be “unprocessed” and “natural.” A culture of the patient’s blood shows gram-positive rods that are catalase positive and display a distinctive tumbling motility in liquid medium. What is the most likely source of the woman’s infection?

A 32-year-old woman became ill 4 days after the onset of her menstrual period. She presented in the emergency room with fever (104°F; normal = 98.6°F), elevated white blood cell count (16,000/mm3; normal = 4,000 to 10,000/mm3), and an erythematous, sunburn like rash on her trunk and extremities. She complained of fatigue, vomiting, and diarrhoea. She had recently eaten at a fast-food restaurant, but otherwise had prepared all her meals at home. The patient described most likely has
Hand wash should be performed for minimum of how much duration?

A 35-year-old man with a CD4 count of 50 presents with a skin nodule on his chest. The nodule is about 3 cm in diameter and is not red, hot, or tender. He says it has been slowly growing bigger for the past 3 weeks. You biopsy the nodule, and the pathologist calls to say that the patient has disseminated cryptococcosis. Which one of the following is the BEST description of what the pathologist saw in the biopsy specimen?

options.label: D
options.text: Budding yeasts with a thick capsule

questions.correct_answer: D. Budding yeasts with a thick capsule

questions.text: Which of the following helminthic diseases is transmitted by direct skin penetration by helminth larvae?

A kitten is taken to the veterinarian because of crusty lesions on its head and ear. The vet, recognizing the infectious nature of the lesion, suggests culture of the lesion and treatment of the kitten to prevent possible transmission of the organism to family members. A 3-week culture of the organism is shown in the photograph. What is the etiologic agent?

A 45-year-old Caucasian male with cough and fever is found on chest X-ray to have a lung infiltrate, hilar adenopathy, and a right-sided pleural effusion. Lung tissue obtained from this patient reveals the findings below. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient’s condition?

A 9-year-old boy presents with a migratory rash with central clearing on the back of his neck. The child had recently been on vacation with his family and had gone hiking. The child’s paediatrician observes the rash and suspects an infection with B. burgdorferi. Which of the following is thought to be a virulence factor of this organism?
questions.correct_answer: D. Expression of outer surface proteins

questions.text: A 3-year-old girl presented to her paediatrician's office with fever, swollen lymph nodes, and a vesicular rash on her chest and upper arms. The vesicles were at various stages of development: some were newly forming, while some were crusted over. Which of the following infectious agents is the most likely cause of this girl’s rash?
Which of the following is the most common portal of entry in Blastomyces dermatitidis infection?

Microscopic examination of a thin blood smear from a patient suspected of having malaria reveals numerous normal size erythrocytes without stippling but with ring stages, many with multiple ring stages and applique forms. Several erythrocytes show developing trophozoites that are spread across the erythrocytes in a band fashion. Which of the following is the most likely cause of infection?

options.label: D
options.text: Mixed infection with two Plasmodium species

questions.correct_answer: D. Mixed infection with two Plasmodium species

questions.text: A 12-year-old boy reports feeling tingling and itching of his legs 30 minutes after swimming in a lake. Over the next day, small papules develop followed by blisters of the legs. Dermatitis due to schistosome infection is diagnosed. What larval stage most likely caused the infection?

A patient comes into the clinic and describes progressive muscle weakness over several weeks. He has also experienced nausea, vomiting, and diarrhoea. One month ago, he had been completely healthy and describes a bear hunting trip in Alaska, where they ate some of the game they killed. Soon after he returned, his gastrointestinal symptoms began followed by muscle weakness in his jaw and neck that has now spread to his arms and lower back. Examination confirms decreased muscle strength in the upper extremities and neck. He also has slowed extraocular movements. Laboratory examination shows panic values for elevated eosinophils and serum creatine phosphokinase. Which of the following organisms is most likely the cause of his symptoms?
True about the process shown in the figure is

options.label: B
options.text: Does not cause host cell lysis

options.label: C
options.text: Such viruses are sensitive to detergents, organic solvents, and harsh environmental conditions

questions.text: Match the Following Type ? Each question shall have two columns with four items in one column (A) that need to be matched appropriately with the best alternative available in the next column(B).

Your patient is a 2-year-old boy who has had several episodes of pustules and lymphadenitis caused by Staphylococcus aureus. His immunoglobulins and complement levels are normal. A nitroblue tetrazolium test reveals defective cells. Which one of the following cells is the most likely to be defective?

A 56-year-old homeless, alcoholic, and febrile man is brought to the emergency department after a difficult night during which his coughing kept everyone at the shelter awake. On arrival his pulse is rapid, and his breathing is laboured with diffuse rales. Endotracheal aspirates produce a mucopurulent discharge containing numerous gram-positive cocci in pairs. His serum contains high titres of IgM antibodies specific for the polysaccharide capsule of Streptococcus pneumoniae. The effector mechanism most likely to act in concert with this early IgM production to clear infection is

In a patient who later developed an allergy to a certain antigen , the initial response to the antigen consisted of immunoglobulin of the lgM class. However, over time, antigen-specific lgE came to be predominant. This change from an lgM to an lgE response is caused by
T-cell receptors, when coexpressed with CD8 molecules, are restricted to recognizing and binding peptide fragments associated with
Which cytokine is essential for T-cell proliferation and is also necessary for the production of CD25-positive regulatory T cells?
Which immune system cells recognize body cells with reduced expression of MHC class I molecules?
Organism which cannot be grown on artificial culture media

Each question shall have two statements: Assertion (A) and Reason (B) connected by the term “because”. The appropriate answer should be marked using the following key Assertion: Pili are important virulence factors of bacteria Reason: They help in attachment to mucosal epithelium

options.label: A
options.text: Both Assertion and Reasons are independently true / correct statements and the Reason is the correct explanation for the Assertion

options.label: B
options.text: Both Assertion and Reasons are independently true / correct statements, but the Reason is not the correct explanation for the Assertion

options.label: C
options.text: Assertion is independently a true / correct statement, but the Reasons is independently a false / incorrect statement

options.label: D
options.text: Assertion is independently a false / incorrect statement, but the Reasons is independently a true / correct statement

options.label: E
options.text: Both Assertion and Reasons are independently false / incorrect statements

questions.correct_answer: A. Both Assertion and Reasons are independently true / correct statements and the Reason is the correct explanation for the Assertion

questions.text: Each question shall have two statements: Assertion (A) and Reason (B) connected by the term “because”. The appropriate answer should be marked using the following key Assertion: Meningococcus has a protein capsule. Reason: Meningococcus has 5 serologic groups

options.label: A
options.text: Both Assertion and Reasons are independently true / correct statements and the Reason is the correct explanation for the Assertion

options.label: B
options.text: Both Assertion and Reasons are independently true / correct statements, but the Reason is not the correct explanation for the Assertion

options.label: C
options.text: Assertion is independently a true / correct statement, but the Reasons is independently a false / incorrect statement

options.label: D
options.text: Assertion is independently a false / incorrect statement, but the Reasons is independently a true / correct statement

options.label: E
options.text: Both Assertion and Reasons are independently false / incorrect statements

questions.correct_answer: E. Both Assertion and Reasons are independently false / incorrect statements
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • N. meningitidis (meningococcus) has a prominent polysaccharide
  • • capsule that enhances virulence by its antiphagocytic action and induces protective antibodies . Meningococci are divided into at least 13 serologic groups on the basis of the antigenicity of their capsular polysaccharides. Five serotypes cause most cases of meningitis and meningococcemia: A, B, C, Y, and W-135

questions.correct_answer: A. Both Assertion and Reasons are independently true / correct statements and the Reason is the correct explanation for the Assertion

options.label: A

questions.text: Microscopic examination of faeces of a patient who has been passing foul-smelling, bulkystools revealed the following? Which of the following is the causative organism?

Sputum gram stain of a 24 year old man who presented with pneumonia revealed the following picture. The organism was found to be alpha haemolytic on blood agar and Optochin sensitivity test was positive for the organism. What is the causative organism in this case?
The phenomenon shown in the image below is inhibited by which of the following?
Microscopic examination from Biopsy of skin lesions from a 43 year old male revealed the following. What is the disease?
Which of the following is a feature of the virus which causes the disease as shown in the image below?

options.label: C
options.text: Receptor of the virus is CD21

questions.correct_answer: B. Virus with linear ss DNA

questions.text: Each EMI /EMQ will broadly have the following components. ü Theme & Focus ü Answer option list ü Lead in question ü Scenarios or Vignettes • There will be two or more scenario / vignette related to the overall Theme & Focus of the question. Culture on SDA revealed white glistening colonies and black colonies grew on bird seed agar. Urease test was positive for the colonies. What is the causative organism?

Case 2: Your patient is a 75-year-old woman with a 110 pack-year history of cigarette smoking who now has a fever of 39°C and a cough productive of yellowish sputum. Gram stain of the sputum shows small gram-negative rods. There is no growth on blood agar, but colonies do grow on chocolate agar supplemented with hemin and NAD. Which bacterium is the most likely cause of her pneumonia?

Gram stain of the pus revealed a gram-negative rod that formed colourless colonies on EMB agar.Black necrotic lesions were also noted on the skin. What is the most important virulence factor of the causative organism ?

On physical examination, his temperature is 39°C and coarse rhonchi are heard bilaterally. Chest X-ray shows interstitial infiltrates bilaterally. Diagnosis was made by ELISA that detected viral antigen in nasal washings. What is the causative agent?

Each EMI /EMQ will broadly have the following components. Theme & Focus Answer option list Lead in question Scenarios or Vignettes There will be two or more scenario / vignette related to the overall Theme & Focus of the question. The candidate should select the best possible answer from the Answer Option List Case 2 An 11-year-old boy attending summer Boy Scout camp develops symptoms of sore throat, headache, fatigue, and conjunctivitis. He is seen by the camp medical staff and on examination is found to have a slight fever of 39.8°C (103.6°F), but no rash. Within the next 1–2 days, several of the other campers develop similar symptoms, which last for 5–7 days. The larger number of campers with similar symptoms indicates that a common source of infection is causing the outbreak. Which of the following activities is the most likely source of the campers’ infection?
In the following gram stained specimen, identify the bacteria seen?
Why are schizont and late trophozoite stages of Plasmodium falciparum not seen in peripheral blood smear?

options.label: A
options.text: They are sequestered in the spleen

options.label: B
options.text: Due to adherence to the capillary endothelium, they are not seen in peripheral blood

options.label: C
options.text: Due to antigen- antibody reaction and removal

options.label: D
options.text: They are seen in mosquito blood

questions.correct_answer: B. Due to adherence to the capillary endothelium, they are not seen in peripheral blood

questions.text: In a child admitted with Hemophilus influenzae meningitis, cefotaxime was started instead of ampicillin. Which of these is the likely reason for this?

options.label: A
options.text: H.influenzae stains are known to produce Beta lactamase

options.label: B
options.text: H.influenzae stains are known to have altered penicillin binding proteins

options.label: C
options.text: Cefotaxime is easier to administer then ampicilin

options.label: D
options.text: Drug of choice for this condition is sulphamethoxazole

questions.correct_answer: A. H.influenzae stains are known to produce Beta lactamase

questions.text: Papain cleaves the immunoglobulin molecule into

options.label: D
options.text: 1 Fab and one hyper variable region

questions.text: Dendritic cells, macrophages, and what other cell types are considered “professional antigen presenting cells,” capable of antigen presentation to T helper cells?
Which one of the following cytokines plays the most important role in protection against intracellular growth (reactivation) of Mycobacterium tuberculosis?

A 67-year-old man, who is an avid gardener, presents at an emergency department. He is suffering from spastic paralysis, which began in his right hand and now extends to his jaw muscles. The causative agent of this infection produces a virulence factor with which of the following activities?

options.label: A
options.text: Overstimulation of T cells with resulting massive release of cytokines

options.label: B
options.text: Blockage of the release of the neurotransmitter acetylcholine from synaptic vesicles

options.label: C
options.text: Adenosine diphosphate–ribosylation of EF-2, resulting in inhibition of protein synthesis

options.label: D
options.text: Blockage of the release of the inhibitory neurotransmitter glycine

questions.correct_answer: D. Blockage of the release of the inhibitory neurotransmitter glycine

questions.text: A distinctive feature of spirochetes is the presence of
Which of the following helminthic diseases is transmitted by direct skin penetration by helminth larvae?

A 33-year-old HIV-positive man complains of headache and blurred vision. Physical examination reveals papilledema and ataxia. A head CT scan is normal, but CSF obtained by lumbar puncture reveals encapsulated organisms visible by India ink. Which of the following is true concerning this organism?

options.label: A
options.text: It can also be seen as “spaghetti and meatballs” on KOH stain

options.label: B
options.text: It consists of branching septate hyphae

options.label: C
options.text: It exists as a mycelial form at room temperature and a yeast at 37.0 C (98.6 F)

options.label: D
options.text: It is an encapsulated nondimorphic yeast found worldwide

questions.correct_answer: D. It is an encapsulated nondimorphic yeast found worldwide

questions.text: Which one of the following media is most suitable for identifying Neisseria gonorrhoeae in a cervical swab?

A 25-year-old woman whose blood tested positive for hepatitis B surface antigen gave birth to a full-term child. Which of the following therapies would be most likely to minimize the transmission of hepatitis B to the neonate?

options.label: C
options.text: Administer hepatitis B immunoglobulin and hepatitis B vaccine.

questions.correct_answer: C. Administer hepatitis B immunoglobulin and hepatitis B vaccine.

questions.text: A component of the cell membrane of most fungi is
A fungus that can attack hair is
Which of the following statements regarding Actinomyces and Nocardia is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Both organisms have branching growth but are prokaryotes.

options.label: B
options.text: Neither can be cultured in the laboratory

options.label: C
options.text: Nocardia infections are endogenous and often initiated by trauma.

options.label: D
options.text: Actinomyces usually causes infections in systemically compromised patients.

questions.correct_answer: A. Both organisms have branching growth but are prokaryotes.

questions.text: Which one of the following is characteristic of Chlamydiae?

options.label: A
options.text: Reticulate bodies are an infectious, extracellular form of the organism.

options.label: B
options.text: Most genital tract infections are asymptomatic and undiagnosed and untreated.

questions.correct_answer: B. Most genital tract infections are asymptomatic and undiagnosed and untreated.

questions.text: Which of the following neisserial virulence factors is part of the tetravalent vaccine that protects against some but not all serogroups of Neisseria meningitidis?
Listeria monocytogenes shows which of the following characteristics?

options.label: A
options.text: It can grow at refrigerator temperatures (4°C).

questions.correct_answer: A. It can grow at refrigerator temperatures (4°C).

questions.text: Diagnosis of diphtheria is confirmed by:

options.label: A
options.text: Microscopic appearance of organisms stained with methylene blue.

options.label: B
options.text: Isolation of a typical colony on Tinsdale agar.

options.label: C
options.text: Isolation of typical organisms from materials such as blood, showing invasiveness.

options.label: D
options.text: Demonstration of toxin production by a suspicious isolate.

questions.correct_answer: D. Demonstration of toxin production by a suspicious isolate.

questions.text: During an infection with Streptococcus pyogenes, an individual generated sufficiently high levels of lgM and lgG antibodies against a S. pyogenes antigen with structural similarity with molecules on the heart that cardiac damage was caused. In this example, the microbe contributed to autoimmunity via a process known as
Which of the following is false regarding enterohemorrhagic E. coli (EHEC)-induced diarrhoea?

options.label: A
options.text: The most common strain of E.coli causing haemolytic-uremic syndrome (HUS) is E.coli O157:H7

options.label: B
options.text: It is almost always associated with fever

options.label: C
options.text: Significant abdominal pain and faecal leukocytes are common

options.label: D
options.text: There is person to person transmission

questions.correct_answer: B. It is almost always associated with fever

questions.text: Regarding the primary and secondary (anamnestic) immune responses, which one of the following is most accurate?

options.label: A
options.text: The IgM made in the primary response is made primarily by memory B cells.

options.label: B
options.text: The lag phase is shorter in the primary response than in the secondary response.

options.label: C
options.text: In the primary response, memory B cells are produced, but memory T cells are not.

options.label: D
options.text: The amount of IgG made in the secondary response is greater than the amount made in the primary response

questions.correct_answer: D. The amount of IgG made in the secondary response is greater than the amount made in the primary response

questions.text: Which one of the following is an attribute of the innate, rather than the adaptive (acquired), arm of our host defences?

options.label: A
options.text: Is highly specific in its response to bacteria

options.label: B
options.text: Responds to viruses and fungi, but not bacteria

options.label: C
options.text: Exhibits memory following exposure to bacteria

options.label: D
options.text: Is as effective the first time it is exposed to bacteria as it is subsequent times

questions.correct_answer: D. Is as effective the first time it is exposed to bacteria as it is subsequent times

questions.text: What process is shown in the figure?
Which of the following statement is true?

options.label: B
options.text: Nutrient broth is a basal medium

options.label: D
options.text: Chocolate agar is a selective medium

questions.correct_answer: B. Nutrient broth is a basal medium

questions.text: All of the following forces are involved in antigen antibody reaction except
Which portion of MHC 1 complex forms the component of antigen presenting part?
questions.correct_answer: B. Distal part of alpha chain

questions.text: 48 years old Mohan has intra-abdominal sepsis. The causative organism was found to be vancomycin, gentamycin and ampicillin resistant. It grows well in presence of 6.5% NaCl and arginine. Bile esculin hydrolysis is positive. Which of the following is this organism?
Each of the following statements concerning rhinoviruses is correct EXCEPT:

options.label: A
options.text: Rhinoviruses are picornaviruses (i.e., small, nonenveloped viruses with an RNA genome).

options.label: B
options.text: Rhinoviruses are an important cause of lower respiratory tract infections, especially in patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

options.label: C
options.text: Rhinoviruses do not infect the gastrointestinal tract because they are inactivated by the acid pH in the stomach

options.label: D
options.text: There is no vaccine against rhinoviruses because they have too many antigenic types

questions.correct_answer: B. Rhinoviruses are an important cause of lower respiratory tract infections, especially in patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

questions.text: A 20-year-old man, who for many years had received daily injections of growth hormone prepared from human pituitary glands, develops ataxia, slurred speech, and dementia. At autopsy the brain shows widespread neuronal degeneration, a spongy appearance due to many vacuoles between the cells, no inflammation, and no evidence of virus particles. The MOST likely diagnosis is:
Each of the following statements concerning fungi and protozoa is correct EXCEPT:

options.label: A
options.text: Both fungi and protozoa are eukaryotic organisms.

options.label: B
options.text: Fungi possess a cell wall, whereas protozoa do not.

options.label: C
options.text: Both fungi and protozoa use flagella as their organ of motility.

options.label: D
options.text: Both fungi and protozoa generate energy in mitochondria.

questions.correct_answer: C. Both fungi and protozoa use flagella as their organ of motility.

questions.text: A 30-year-old woman with systemic lupus erythematosus is found to have a positive serologic test for syphilis (VDRL test). She denies having had sexual contact with a partner who had symptoms of a venereal disease. The next best step would be to:

options.label: A
options.text: Reassure her that the test is a false-positive reaction related to her autoimmune disorder

options.label: B
options.text: Trace her sexual contacts for serologic testing

options.label: D
options.text: Perform a fluorescent treponemal antibody-absorbed (FTA-ABS) test on a specimen of her serum

questions.correct_answer: D. Perform a fluorescent treponemal antibody-absorbed (FTA-ABS) test on a specimen of her serum

questions.text: A patient skin-tested with purified protein derivative (PPD) to determine previous exposure to Mycobacterium tuberculosis develops induration at the skin test site 48 hours later. Histologically, the reaction site would MOST probably show:
questions.correct_answer: C. Helper T cells and macrophages

questions.text: Each of the following statements concerning trichinosis is correct EXCEPT:

options.label: A
options.text: Trichinosis is acquired by eating undercooked pork.

options.label: B
options.text: Trichinosis is caused by a protozoan that has both a trophozoite and a cyst stage in its life cycle

options.label: C
options.text: Trichinosis can be diagnosed by seeing cysts in muscle biopsy specimens.

questions.correct_answer: B. Trichinosis is caused by a protozoan that has both a trophozoite and a cyst stage in its life cycle

questions.text: All are true about Respiratory Syncytial Viruses except
questions.correct_answer: C. May be prevented by vaccination
